text: is a Japanese women's field hockey player who competed in the 2004 Summer Olympics and in three Summer Olympic Games.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "Rika Komazawa" ; retrieved 2012-7-20. ==Early life== Komazawa was born in Sennan, Osaka. As a schoolgirl, she became interested in field hockey. At Tenri University, she played on the school's field hockey team. 日本代表の駒沢加入 ホッケー女子コカ WRS, Chugoku Shimbun (Japan). February 27, 2010; retrieved 2012-7-20. ==International competitions== ===Timeline=== * 2004: 2004 Summer Olympics * 2008: 2008 Summer Olympics * 2012: Summer Olympic GamesInternational Hockey Federation (FIH), "London welcomes Japan to the Olympics," May 5, 2012; retrieved 2012-7-20. ==Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Osaka Prefecture Category:Field hockey players
title: Rika Komazawa
